Title.evidence: This study aims to examine the impact of sarcopenia on postoperative delirium and a range of perioperative outcomes in elderly patients.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to examine the impact of sarcopenia on postoperative delirium and a range of perioperative outcomes in elderly patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of postoperative delirium.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A significant association was found between sarcopenia and postoperative delirium in both univariable and multivariable analyses (univariable: OR 1.81, 95% confidence interval [CI] 1.31 to 2.50, P < 0.001, I 2 24.0%; multivariable: OR 2.42, 95% CI 1.27 to 4.59, P = 0.007, I 2 0.0%).

Harms.evidence: Sarcopenia was also associated with adverse postoperative outcomes, including increased complications, mortality, delayed recovery, and reduced overall survival.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Systematic review registration: PROSPERO registration number CRD42023424696 (18 May 2023)
